#Text=Food packages to Vestas occupiers cut off
#Text=Sunday , August 2 , 2009
#Text=Food deliveries from the RMT were allowed into the Vestas plant in Newport , England yesterday , but were cut off by Vestas management this afternoon .
#Text=Protesters at the Isle of Wight factory celebrated the delivery of supermarket bags filed with groceries , which entered with a police escort .
#Text=This morning , the sixteen remaining occupiers were told to prepare a list of items for future deliveries .

#Text=But , according to " Mark " , an occupier in the Vestas plant , this afternoon Vestas management reversed their decision , terming the August 1 food delivery a one-time " goodwill gesture " and saying food would no longer be allowed in .
#Text=The food delivery followed a formal complaint by the RMT that denying the occupiers food was a violation of their human rights .

#Text=The people inside the factory have been conducting their occupation since July 20 , in protest against the closure of the factory , which produces wind turbine blades for the generation of wind power , and the loss of 625 jobs in the Isle of Wight and nearby areas .
#Text=Mark went on to praise the " brave people " who have circumvented the security ring around the plant in order to get food and other items to the occupiers .
#Text=An electric kettle thrown at the end of a rope up to the occupiers is said to be working well .
#Text=Mark also noted that Louise Christian , a prominent British human rights lawyer , is now representing the Vestas occupiers .

#Text=While the number of occupiers at the Vestas plant — originally nearly thirty , now only sixteen — have dwindled , Mark says the ones who remain are " very determined " and furthermore hold no ill will toward their co-workers who have left the occupation .

#Text=In particular , the occupiers offered sympathy for Luke Paxton , who they say left the occupation due to a combination of personal issues and malnutrition brought on by the deprivation of food .
#Text=Paxton , Mark said , has the remaining occupiers ' " full support " and continues to campaign for the Vestas workers .
#Text=Mark also clarified the origins of the occupation .

#Text=In contrast to claims that green socialist group Workers ' Climate Action were behind the occupation , Mark presented a more nuanced picture : the Vestas workers ' initial contacts were with veterans of the occupation of Visteon ' s auto parts plants , with the AWL , SWP and Socialist Party becoming involved later with " quite a big involvement " from all groups .

#Text=Members of Workers ' Climate Action attended Vestas workers ' meetings and gave their opinions , but , Mark says , a committee organised by the workers and composed of workers was making all the decisions .
#Text=We have Polish workers with us .
#Text=They 're our friends .
#Text=Mark also strongly rejected the support of Solidarity , a " nationalist trade union " closely associated with the BNP .

#Text=Neil O'Brien of centre-right think tank Policy Exchange told The Daily Telegraph that , while labour unrest had increased , the current state of affairs is  nothing compared to what is going to happen once the brakes are slammed on public spending .
